intro: Maytenus scutioides, commonly known as the Mexican mullein, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are small drupes that contain a single seed. Maytenus scutioides is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its traditional medicinal uses.
